DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine glycemic efficacy safety dulaglutide compare insulin glargine treatment participant type 2 diabetes moderate severe chronic kidney disease .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Comparing Dulaglutide With Insulin Glargine Glycemic Control Participants With Type 2 Diabetes ( T2D ) Moderate Severe Chronic Kidney Disease ( CKD )
DOC.criteria: Men nonpregnant woman age ≥18 year Hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ) ≥7.5 % ≤10.5 % Type 2 diabetes insulin insulin + oral antihyperglycemic medication Participants presume diabetic kidney disease without hypertensive nephrosclerosis diagnose moderate severe CKD estimate glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) ≥15 < 60 milliliter per minute ( mL/min ) /1.73 meter square ( m^2 ) Able willing perform multiple daily injection Body mass index ( BMI ) 23 45 kilogram/square meter ( kg/m^2 ) Stage 5 CKD define eGFR < 15 mL/min/1.73 m^2 OR require dialysis Rapidly progress renal dysfunction likely require renal replacement History transplant organ Type 1 diabetes mellitus At screen systolic blood pressure ≥150 mmHg diastolic blood pressure ≥90 mmHg without antihypertensive medication An episode ketoacidosis hyperosmolar state/coma past 6 month history severe hypoglycemia past 3 month prior Screening Visit Cardiovascular condition within 12 week prior randomization : acute myocardial infarction , New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class III class IV heart failure , cerebrovascular accident ( stroke ) Acute chronic hepatitis Signs symptoms chronic acute pancreatitis , past diagnose pancreatitis Serum calcitonin ≥35 picograms per milliliter ( pg/mL ) Screening Visit Self family history medullary Ccell hyperplasia , focal hyperplasia , carcinoma Known history untreated proliferative retinopathy
